The last thing you want is for your dwarves to run alone to fetch something deep in enemy territory.

In order to let your dwarves know where.string:
In order to let your dwarves know where to go, use the Claim designation.  When you select it, you'll notice that many of
the items on the screen turn green.  These are objects which are currently being ignored.  They'll also be surrounded by {}.

You can press [IKEY:HELP] any time for h.string:
You can press [IKEY:HELP] any time for help.  Press it now for help on how to use this text viewer.
And remember:

[C:2:0:1]Last time you lost it was fun,.string: [C:2:0:1]Last time you lost it was fun, and it'll be fun this time too![C:7:0:0]

Now that the world has been generated, i.string:
Now that the world has been generated, it's time to prepare your settlers to travel.  There are three main screens.
Instructions for which keys to press are displayed at the bottom of each screen.

The Site Selection Screen shows you wher.string: The Site Selection Screen shows you where your fortress is located, and the general characteristics of the surrounding area.  You can place your fortress in any location so long as the selection rectangle isn't entirely in an ocean, lake or mountain biome.

The Unit Preparation Screen has a list o.string:
The Unit Preparation Screen has a list of the dwarves that are going on the journey and their skills.
Dwarves learn as they work, so it's not essential to spend a lot of points here, but you might find it convenient to
let them know what their main roles are at this point by making them novices in a few skills.  For instance, if you make
one of the dwarves a "Novice Miner", then that dwarf will immediately grab a pick and take any mining orders you prepare.

You buy skills with points. Keep in min.string:
You buy skills with points.  Keep in mind that the skill list scrolls.
The amount of points you have is displayed on the lower right.
These points are also used to buy equipment on the Equipment Preparation Screen.

The Equipment Preparation Screen is the.string:
The Equipment Preparation Screen is the most complicated of the three screens.  The list of objects your dwarves are bringing along appears on the left, and the list of animals going on the journey appears on the right.  If you choose to add a new object, you'll be taken to a screen with a list of all the potential items that you can bring.  Type in a partial name to narrow the list.
You can leave this screen by selecting an object or by pressing [IKEY:LEAVESCREEN].

If you aren't careful, your fortress can.string:
If you aren't careful, your fortress can become a cluttered and inefficient mess.
In fact, you'll find one of your principal roles in managing the fortress is to get food, materials and finished goods to
move around efficiently.

The main method for moving objects aroun.string:
The main method for moving objects around is the designation of stockpiles.  A stockpile has certain object types associated to it,
and any object that isn't already stored will be brought to a free space in the pile when a dwarf with the proper hauling profession
has some free time.

Using the mastery option, you can make p.string:
Using the mastery option, you can make piles take objects from other piles to create a flow of goods throughout
the fortress.

Stockpiles fill up quickly. In order to.string: Stockpiles fill up quickly.  In order to consolidate objects and save space, dwarves use bins.

Once you make a bin, the dwarves will mo.string: Once you make a bin, the dwarves will move it to a furniture stockpile.  The next time a bin is needed, a dwarf will place an object in the bin, and then the bin will be moved to the proper stockpile.  All you have to do is provide a consistent supply of bins.

Barrels are exactly like bins, but they.string: Barrels are exactly like bins, but they are used for food.  Food in barrels is less susceptible to pests, though barrels are not immune to their clever and persistent vermin natures.

Dwarves will amass personal property ove.string: Dwarves will amass personal property over time, especially when the coin economy begins in the middle game.  If a dwarf has a room, you'll soon find that personal possessions cover the floor.  In order to give the dwarf more storage space, consider placing a chest and a cabinet within the room.  Cabinets are used for storing clothes, and chests are used to store everything else.  Certain important dwarves will require weapon and armor racks in their rooms as well.

[C:6:0:1](Sword)[C:7:0:0] Not produced o.string: [C:6:0:1](Sword)[C:7:0:0] Not produced on-site, does not count towards wealth[R]

See readme.txt for the license.\nSee fil.string:
See readme.txt for the license.
See file_changes.txt for new init/interface information.
See command_line.txt for information on world generation from command lines.

(1) Copy the relevant region folder in \.string: (1) Copy the relevant region folder in "data/save" to a safe location.

(2) When you want to reuse it, copy that.string: (2) When you want to reuse it, copy that region back to "data/save".  Do *NOT* overwrite an old folder, as it might leave residual files.

Please *DO* back up saves. Although the.string:
Please *DO* back up saves.  Although the game has permanent death and you might want to play it in that spirit, the game
is also in development, and your world might become corrupted by an error.  You can also make use of the auto save features settable in "data/init/init.txt".

(0) ***Note that version 0.40.03+ is not.string: (0) ***Note that version 0.40.03+ is not compatible with older versions.***

(1) Unzip the new dwarves into a *NEW* f.string: (1) Unzip the new dwarves into a *NEW* folder.

(2) Copy \"data/save\" from the old fold.string: (2) Copy "data/save" from the old folder into the new folder, or copy over the relevant region folders you've saved to "data/save".  Keep a backup in case something is wrong with the new version.

(3) When you start, your world should be.string: (3) When you start, your world should be accessible and ready to play.

Unzipping the new dwarves into your old.string: Unzipping the new dwarves into your old folder will work most of the time, but if files have changed, it can crash, or worse yet, destroy your saves.

Go to \"data/init/init.txt\". These opt.string: Go to "data/init/init.txt".  These options will take effect the next time you start the game.

If you can get to the ESC keybindings me.string: If you can get to the ESC keybindings menu (from the start screen, press ESC and then 2/8 to scroll to Key Bindings), you can set your key bindings.  If your "?" key on your keyboard doesn't work for help, you can set the keybinding properly here.  It might not display as a "*".  You can set the display up properly in "data/init/interface.txt" using the display strings at the top of the file.

[IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.  You can check the key bindings for your current settings.  You can get to the key bindings
by pressing [IKEY:OPTIONS].

Here are some practice links to try:

[B]Press [IKEY:LEAVESCREEN] to close the text viewer.  If there
is a paused section (as there is in this screen), it will open up before [IKEY:LEAVESCREEN] makes you leave.  [IKEY:SELECT] will also work if no link is highlighted.

[B]In order to practice scrolling, I've.string: [B]In order to practice scrolling, I've put the pause instructions down the page a bit.

Sometimes there is a pause in a text vie.string: Sometimes there is a pause in a text viewer window.  Press [IKEY:LEAVESCREEN] to advance.  If no link is highlighted, [IKEY:SELECT] will work as well.

Good job. Here are some more practice l.string: Good job.  Here are some more practice links to try out.  Notice how the interface interacts with scrolling.

Sometimes your dwarves need to trade awa.string:
Sometimes your dwarves need to trade away their wealth to obtain necessities.  You do this at a trade depot.
Merchants arrive throughout the year, starting in the first autumn.

You can go to the trade depot both to de.string:
You can go to the trade depot both to designate goods to be brought to the depot for trade and to perform
the actual transactions.

A common way to get to unit profiles is.string:
Uma forma comum de obter perfis de unidades é carregar em [IKEY:D_VIEWUNIT] a partir do ecrã principal, movendo
o cursor sobre a unidade e carregando em [IKEY:UNITVIEW_PRF] e a seguir [IKEY:UNITVIEW_PRF_VIEW].

There are also a few other screens that.string: Existem alguns outros ecrãs onde é possível ver o perfil de unidades directamente.

Here you can view a unit's holdings and.string: Aqui pode ver os pertences e requisitos de uma unidade, bem como os seus pensamentos e preferências.

The holdings, requirements, demands and.string:
As posses, requisitos, exigências e mandatos da unidade serão listadas no ecrã. Para aceder aos pensamentos e preferências da mesma,
simplesmente carregue em [IKEY:SELECT].

The thoughts and preferences of a unit l.string:
The thoughts and preferences of a unit let you know what has been happening to a unit and the things that would please them.  All of the
information you see here is used by the game.

An important part of Dwarf Fortress is l.string:
An important part of Dwarf Fortress is learning how to keep dwarves happy.  If dwarves become
unhappy, they can throw tantrums, damage property, start fights and eventually lose their minds.

Your dwarves need to drink. They'll att.string: Os seus anões precisaram de beber. Eles tentarão obter bebida de fontes de água próximas. Pode também locais específicos onde poderão beber através de zonas de atividades. Eles beberão também de quaisquer poços que tenha construído, desde que ditos poços tenham um caminho aberto abaixo deles até um quadrado preenchido de água.

Eventually, you'll want to secure alcoho.string: Eventualmente, terá de obter álcool para os seus anões. Para tal, precisará de plantas e uma destiladora. Iremos falar de como operar edifícios como a destiladora na secção de Artes de Fabrico, e como obter plantas na secção de Obter Comida.

Wood is the starting point for many fort.string: Madeira é o ponto de início para muitas industrias da fortaleza. Para cortar madeira, precisará do seguinte:

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, u.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] Um anão saudável e desocupado com um machado e a profissão de Lenhador

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A tree desig.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] Uma árvore marcada para corte que esse anão consiga aceder

The initial purpose for wood is building.string: O propósito inicial da madeira é a construção de camas e outra mobília, assim como bestas e flechas para fins defensivos. Quando encontrar minérios metálicos, poderá também utilizar madeira na fornalha para criar carvão que poderá, então, ser usado no fundidor para refinar minério. Madeira pode também ser queimada na fornalha para criar cínza, utilizável posteriormente na misturadora para criar lixívia. Lixívia pode ser usada para fazer sabão (em conjunto com gordura animal) ou pode ser transformada em potassa, em si um fertilizante. Potassa pode ser cozina num forno para criar cínza de potássio, utilizada para criar vidro transparente.
